instructions.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
instructions.data:
Wipe the surface with a rag soaked in paint thinner to remove grease, oil, wax and other foreign matter.
For new galvanized surfaces:
Etch the surface by applying 10% BOYSEN®® Metal Etching Solution B‑71 (Dilute 1 part of B‑71 to 9 parts water). Rinse with water and dry immediately. Note: Unpainted galvanized surfaces that have been exposed for 6 months or more need not be etched. However, formation of rust or corrosion should be treated prior to painting.

instructions.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
instructions.data: Primer: BOYSEN®® Epoxy Primer Red Oxide B‑2277 or BOYSEN®® Epoxy Primer Gray B‑2230 Topcoat (in required number of coats): BOYSEN®® Automotive Lacquer

instructions.title: NOTES
instructions.data: For thinning solvent, use only BOYSEN®® Epoxy Reducer B‑55 for primer and BOYSEN®® Lacquer Thinner B‑50 for topcoat. Immediately apply primer after surface preparation to avoid occurrence of flash rusting. Application of topcoat should be done within 7 days after priming to ensure good intercoat adhesion, otherwise re-application of primer is needed. If necessary, add approximately 10% by volume of BOYSEN®® Lacquer Flo B‑1205 to the ready-to-use topcoat mixture.

calculator.title: Primer
calculator.item: BOYSEN®® Epoxy Primer White B‑2200
